project.name: C-C821A-SUBV-02-ST02-DT05-DF12-CF12-01
project.description: Creating test case using base program. Added an environment variable read to get a filename to read in the file contents using an fread operation within the function Completed injection.

iopair.name: C-C821A-SUBV-02-ST02-DT05-DF12-CF12-01-GOOD-01
iopair.description: create a repository This weakness expects a string in the form: '<qsize> <file1> <file2> <data>' where qsize is the size of the quick sort (used to delay execution in certan benign cases), file1 and file2 are files used to dealy execution and data is a string containing no spaces. If the input starts with an A and is greater than 50 characters in length, and the qsize is large enough, incorrect syncronization (two separate locks) will lead to division by zero. For the weakness to occur, the input must begin with an 'A', be greater than 50 characters in length, and file1 and file2 must be FIFO files controlled by runFifo.py fifo1 fifo2.

process.script: if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/preprocess_daemon_script_01.pid" ]]; then killtree.sh -s 9 -p $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/preprocess_daemon_script_01.pid") && echo "Killed script."; else echo "Failed: Script PID file does not exist."; fi

scoring_formula.formula: STDOUT AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT

iopair.name: C-C821A-SUBV-02-ST02-DT05-DF12-CF12-01-GOOD-02

For the weakness to occur, the input must begin with an 'A', be greater than 50 characters in length, and file1 and file2 must be FIFO files controlled by runFifo.py fifo1 fifo2.

process.script: cd ../good-02 && cp file.txt stonesoup && cd stonesoup && $SS_TC_DEPS/bin/svn add file.txt

if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/preprocess_daemon_script_01.pid" ]]; then killtree.sh -s 9 -p $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/preprocess_daemon_script_01.pid") && echo "Killed script."; else echo "Failed: Script PID file does not exist."; fi

scoring_formula.formula: CHECKOUT AND ADD AND COMMIT AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT
